alert.note: Alert for Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 8:49AM AKST until January 01 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches through this morning. Lighter snow of 2 to 4 inches will follow Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * WHERE...Portions of the central Inner Channels including Juneau, Petersburg, Kake, and Wrangell. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reports around Juneau revealed around 6 to 8 inches of snow accumulation had fallen as of Friday evening. As of around 5 AM, approximately 7 to 10 inches had fallen throughout the Juneau Borough. Petersburg reported 15.8 inches of snowfall as of 5 AM this morning. Lighter snow of 2 to 4 inches will follow through Saturday evening.
info.instruction: A warning means that a winter storm is already occurring or imminent. This storm could pose a threat to life and property. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
